I have 4 IMAP accounts setup in TB, all within the same domain.
I have defined specific maps for Concepts, Sent, Trash and Spam on my mail server.
I have set these maps in the settings of each mail account in TB.
I have subscribed to all maps.
Now I restart TB and some maps (randomly, but never Inbox or the first account) are gone, in the activity manager console i can read that the disappeard maps are deleted, but lukily for me, they are not. When i refresh the subscriptions again, they will appear again.
It also does not matter if there are mails within the map.


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Setup multiple IMAP accounts
2. Set all maps by hand
3. Restart TB

comments.raw_text:
Looking at the log files, this is a gmail account. All of the folders that are disappearing are 'maps' of the special use folders that are returned by the XLIST command. I suspect the reason that they are disappearing is that the maps are selected in the account manager for Drafts, Trash, Junk and Sent. When XLIST runs, it deletes those items in favor of the [Gmail]/xxxxxx folders returned by XLIST.

My idea to fix this is in bug 800035.
